medical_history.chief_complaint: 72 hours of epigastric pain migrating to the right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced initially epigastric pain for 72 hours, which later migrated to the RLQ. The pain has intensified and is associated with anorexia and nausea, but without emesis, fever, chills, or change in bowel movements. Initially thought to be another episode of GERD, symptoms worsened, prompting the visit to the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), Depression; no prior abdominal surgeries.
